examples: Users may potentially prefer this approach.
replacements: Use one modal verb, not two

examples: This is arguably the best approach.
This is perhaps the main issue.
The approach seems to work well.
replacements: State what you know or measured

examples: The system appears to handle load well.
This appears to be the bottleneck.

replacements: This has 5 dependencies and 3 edge cases
The process takes 2 seconds vs 50ms target

examples: This is true to some extent.
replacements: This is true in 60% of cases

examples: Caching helps to a certain degree.
This is accurate to a certain degree.
This explains the behavior to a large extent.
Success depends to a large extent on testing.
In most cases, caching improves speed.
replacements: Caching improves speed except for tiny datasets

examples: In many cases, this approach works.
In some cases, optimization is necessary.
It is possible that caching would help.
It is likely that users prefer simplicity.
This may help to reduce latency.
Caching could serve to improve speed.
This has the potential to scale well.
The approach has the potential to succeed.
replacements: The approach might succeed if we fix X

examples: Users presumably want faster load times.
replacements: Users want faster load times (cite survey)
Users abandon sites slower than 3 seconds
